group.name: Instance Group
group.instancesDesc: select instances to create instance group
group.asgsDesc: Select a autoscaling group to create instance group
group.deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the instance group

detail.name: Name
detail.removeInstancesTips: Are you sure you want to remove these instances from instance group?

asg.asgCreateIngestTip1: To complete the setup for this instance group, please select an
asg.asgCreateIngestTip3: to create a log ingestion with this instance group first.
asg.asgTips1: Please add below User Data script to your Auto Scaling Group's launch template or launch configuration (depends on your Auto Scaling Group' s setup, please follow the AWS documentation to update
asg.asgTipsTitle: You will need add below content into your launch template to update your EC2 user data section.
asg.asgTipsDesc: Add below permissions to the IAM instance profile for your ASG.

create.name: Create
create.selectStatus: Please select log agent online instance or waiting all log agent installed successfully.

asg.name: Auto Scaling groups
asg.desc: Select the Auto Scaling group you want to create log ingestion.
asg.selectASG: Please select an Auto Scaling group

comp.instanceGroupDesc: An instance Group is a collection of instances. Currently, only instances in the same region as Solution are supported. Please make sure your instances have meet the following prerequisites.
comp.tips1: AWS Systems Manager Agent (SSM Agent) is installed on the instances.
comp.tips2: AmazonSSMManagedInstanceCore policy is associated with the instances.
comp.tips3: The instances have network access to AWS Systems Manager.
comp.tips4: The Fluent Bit agent has a dependency of OpenSSL 1.1, please make sure OpenSSL 1.1 installed on Linux instances.
comp.groupNameDesc: Enter the name of the log group. The name must be unique, and can only contains lower case letters and -.
comp.defaultOfflineError: Failed to get command invocation response, please check Fluent Bit manually.

config.name: Log Config
config.deleteTips: Are you sure you want to delete the log config

detail.name: Name
detail.notSupportEdit: You are viewing the log config that was used at the time when the pipeline was created, to view the latest version of the log config or edit the log config, please go to:

common.configNameDesc: Enter the name of the log configuration. The name must be unique, and can only contains lower case letters and -.
common.logPathDesc: Enter the location of the log files. All files under the specified folder will be included. Use ' , ' to separate multiple paths.
common.logPathDescEKS: Enter the location of the log files.
common.logTypeDesc: Select the built-in plugin to parse your log data from log agent.
common.logTypeDescSyslog: Select the built-in plugin to parse your log data from log agent. Only can choose syslog-supported log config (i.e., Single-line Text, Syslog, JSON).
common.nginxFormatDesc: The log format configuration of Nginx.
common.nginxFormatInvalid: The specified format is invalid, a standard NGINX configuration file usually begins with log_format.
common.apacheFormatDesc: The log format configuration of Apache. e.g. LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b" common
common.apacheFormatError: The specified format is invalid, a standard APACHE configuration file usually begins with LogFormat.
common.regexFormatDesc: Input the regular expression to parse the log.
common.syslogFormatDesc: Enter the log format template from the syslog configuration file
common.springbootLogFormatDesc:
Enter the log format configuration in the Spring Boot application.
(*The currently generated regular expression only supports standard output format, if it is non-standard output, please use custom regular expression to create.)
common.firstLineRegExDesc: Input the Regular Expression to extract the first of the log.

parsing.alert: Regular expression is invalid, please check your log format.
parsing.sampleLogDesc: Input one line of sample log to validate the Regular Expression.
parsing.sampleLogJSONDesc: Input a JSON format sample log to parse.
parsing.invalid: The verification failed. Make sure that the sample log matches the specified log_format.
parsing.parseLogDesc: Log attributes of the sample log.
parsing.dateTips: You must specify the datetime of the log using key “time”. If not specified, system time will be added.
parsing.timeKeyTips: You must specify the time key of the log. If not specified, system time will be added.
parsing.timeFormatDesc: Input the timestamp format used in your logs.
parsing.sampleRequired: Please input a sample log and parse log to check the log config and regex is valid.
parsing.regexLogParseError: Please confirm that the sample log has been parsed and make sure the log format matches the sample log
parsing.timeKeyDesc: Select the Time Key of the log and input the time format.
parsing.timezoneDesc: Specify the timezone for your log, by default, it is the timezone parsed from your time key. That is, if the time field in your log contains a time zone, you don't need to select it. If you wish to use a different timezone, please select time zone from the timezone list.
parsing.inputJSON: Please input the sample json log
parsing.userLogFormatError: User log format contains non latin characters.
parsing.userLogFormatNotEmpty: User log format must not be empty.
parsing.notJSONFormat: Sample Log is not a JSON format

filter.name: Filter
filter.desc: The solution will collect the logs match ALL the specified conditions only.
filter.alert: You must provide sample logs to add filter condition, please retry after you provide sample logs.

crossAccount.name: Member Accounts
crossAccount.selectDesc1: Select the AWS account at which the log is stored. To create a member account, go to
crossAccount.updateAlert: Please upgrade your CloudFormation stack in the member accounts and update the  Fluent Bit Configuration Files uploading Event Topic ARN field in the member account in the linked account.

list.removeLinkTips: Are you sure you want to remove the account

link.name: Link
link.stepOneTipsDesc: Please deploy the CloudFormation stack in the member account.
link.stepOneUpdateTipsDesc: Please update the CloudFormation stack in this member account.
link.stepOne2: 2. Switch to the same region as Solution deployed in:
link.stepOne3: 3. Create new stack using the template URL:
link.stepOne3Update: 3. Update this stack using the template URL:
link.stepOne6: 6. Update Member Account Fluent Bit Configuration Files uploading Event Topic ARN and save.
link.accountNameDesc: Input a friendly name of the account. The name must be unique. (e.g. sub-account-1)
link.accountRolesDesc: Input the MemberAccountRoleARN in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.installDocsDesc: Input the AgentInstallDocument in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.configDocsDesc: Input the AgentConfigDocument in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.s3BucketDesc: Input the MemberAccountS3Bucket in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.inputS3Bucket: Please input Member Account S3 Bucket
link.stackIdDesc: Input the MemberAccountStackId in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.stackIdSameRegion: Please ensure the stack is deployed in the same region as Solution
link.inputStackId: Please input Member Account CloudFormation Stack Id
link.kmsKeyDesc: Input the MemberAccountKMSKeyARN in the CloudFormation output in Step 1.
link.inputKmsKey: Please input Member Account KMS Key ARN
link.iamInstanceProfileArnDesc: Input MemberAccountIamInstanceProfileARN in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.inputIamInstanceProfileArn: Please input Member Account Instance Profile ARN
link.fbConfigUploadSNSTopicArn: Member Account Fluent Bit Configuration Files uploading Event Topic ARN
link.fbConfigUploadSNSTopicArnDesc: Input MemberAccountFluentBitConfUploadingEventTopicARN in the CloudFormation Output in Step 1.
link.inputFBConfigUploadSNSTopicArn: Please input Member Account Fluent Bit Configuration Files uploading Event Topic ARN.
link.fbConfigUploadSNSTopicArnFormatError: Member Account Fluent Bit Configuration Files uploading Event Topic ARN format error
